summary:
Collect metrics to assess oxidative artifacts.This tool collects metrics quantifying the error rate resulting from oxidative artifacts. For a brief primer on oxidative artifacts, see the GATK Dictionary.

This tool calculates the Phred-scaled probability that an alternate base call results from an oxidation artifact. This probability score is based on base context, sequencing read orientation, and the characteristic low allelic frequency. Please see the following reference for an in-depth discussion of the OxoG error rate.

Lower probability values implicate artifacts resulting from 8-oxoguanine, while higher probability values suggest that an alternate base call is due to either some other type of artifact or is a real variant.

Usage example:

java -jar picard.jar CollectOxoGMetrics \
      I=input.bam \
      O=oxoG_metrics.txt \
      R=reference_sequence.fasta

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: The number of context bases to include on each side of the assayed G/C base.
arguments.name: --CONTEXT_SIZE

arguments.summary: The optional set of sequence contexts to restrict analysis to. If not supplied all contexts are analyzed.
arguments.name: --CONTEXTS

arguments.summary: Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: VCF format dbSNP file, used to exclude regions around known polymorphisms from analysis.
arguments.name: --DB_SNP

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: Whether or not to include non-PF reads.
arguments.name: --INCLUDE_NON_PF_READS

arguments.summary: Input SAM/BAM/CRAM file for analysis.
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: An optional list of intervals to restrict analysis to.
arguments.name: --INTERVALS

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: The maximum insert size for a read to be included in analysis. Set of 0 to allow unpaired reads.
arguments.name: --MAXIMUM_INSERT_SIZE

arguments.summary: The minimum insert size for a read to be included in analysis. Set of 0 to allow unpaired reads.
arguments.name: --MINIMUM_INSERT_SIZE

arguments.summary: The minimum mapping quality score for a base to be included in analysis.
arguments.name: --MINIMUM_MAPPING_QUALITY

arguments.summary: The minimum base quality score for a base to be included in analysis.
arguments.name: --MINIMUM_QUALITY_SCORE

arguments.summary: Location of output metrics file to write.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: For debugging purposes: stop after visiting this many sites with at least 1X coverage.
arguments.name: --STOP_AFTER

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: When available, use original quality scores for filtering.
arguments.name: --USE_OQ

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description: Class for trying to quantify the CpCG->CpCA error rate.
name: CollectOxoGMetrics
